alert.note: Alert for Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 19 at 5:06PM CDT until April 19 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL COMANCHE...WEST CENTRAL GRADY AND SOUTHEASTERN CADDO COUNTIES... At 506 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Apache, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Chickasha, Anadarko, Apache, Cyril, Verden, Cement, Norge, Boone, Lake Ellsworth, Lake Chickasha, Ninnekah, Stecker, and Laverty. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
